intro: Stirlingia, commonly known as the golden bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The leaves are usually simple and opposite, while the fruits are follicles containing seeds. Stirlingia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
